field.label: Connection URL*
field.helpText: Replace ACCOUNTNAME with the full account name provided by Snowflake, it may include [account].[region_id].[platform]

field.label: User Name*
field.helpText: Snowflake username

field.label: Password*
field.helpText: Snowflake password, leave it empty to use key pair authentication

field.label: Private Key String
field.helpText: User private key, leave it empty to use username/password authentication

field.label: Passphrase
field.helpText: Passphrase for your private key, leave it empty if none

field.label: Warehouse Name
field.helpText: Warehouse name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Role
field.helpText: Role to be used, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: S3 Access Key ID
field.helpText: Enter the access key for your AWS account. You manage access keys for your AWS account using the AWS Management Console as the AWS account root user. Leave the field empty to not use bulk loading through AWS S3.

field.label: S3 Secret Key
field.helpText: Enter the secret access key for your AWS account. When you create an access key, AWS allows you to view and download your secret key. Leave the field empty to not use bulk loading through AWS S3.

field.label: Date Time Format
field.helpText: Date and time format used in the database

field.label: Date Format
field.helpText: Date format used in the database

field.label: Time Format
field.helpText: Time format used in the database

field.label: Enable Connection Pooling
field.helpText: Select to enable connection pooling and make other fields active. If this is not enabled, then values for the other fields which are invisible are not saved including the defaults. Connection pooling may increase performance by using resources more efficiently.

field.label: Maximum Connections
field.helpText: Enter the maximum number of connections allowed in the pool at any time. The default is -1, which indicates an unlimited number of connections. You will receive an error if you attempt to exceed the maximum.

field.label: Minimum Connections
field.helpText: Enter the minimum number of connections allowed in the pool at all times. The default is 0.

field.label: Maximum Idle Time
field.helpText: Enter the length of time in seconds that a connection can remain open in an idle state. The default is 0.

field.label: When Exhausted Action
field.helpText: Indicate whether to wait for a connection or immediately fail when a connection pool becomes exhausted.

field.label: Maximum Wait Time
field.helpText: Enter the length of time in seconds to wait for a connection from the pool. The default is 0.

field.label: Test Connection When Borrowing From Pool
field.helpText: Select an option to determine when to test if a connection is still valid.

field.label: Test Connection When Returning From Pool
field.helpText: Select an option to determine when to test if a connection is still valid.

field.label: Test Idle Connections
field.helpText: Select an option to determine when to test if a connection is still valid.

field.label: Validation Query
field.helpText: Enter a simple SQL Statement to return a single row of data that indicates if the connection is valid.

field.label: Document Batching
field.helpText: The records retrieved from database are batched in the output.

field.label: Batch Size
field.helpText: The number of records retrieved per output document for document batching. Batch Size will be ignored unless the document batching check box is enabled in the import page.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Document Batching
field.helpText: The records retrieved from database are batched in the output.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Batch Size
field.helpText: The number of records retrieved per output document for document batching. Batch Size will be ignored unless the document batching check box is enabled in the import page.

field.label: Truncate before loading
field.helpText: Empty snowflake table before loading data into it.

field.label: Batch Size
field.helpText: The number of records sent per database query

field.label: Return Results
field.helpText: Returns the Result in array format if checked.

field.label: Input Options for Missing Fields
field.helpText: Allow the customer to choose from empty value input behavior.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Batch Size
field.helpText: The number of update operations per database query.

field.label: Unique Key(s) (comma separated)
field.helpText: Used as a primary key.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Batch Size
field.helpText: The number of delete operations per database query.

field.label: Unique Key(s) (comma separated)
field.helpText: Used as a primary key.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Batch Size
field.helpText: The number of parameter values per database call.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: SQL Script
field.helpText: Snow SQL script to be executed.

field.label: Number of SnowSQL Statements
field.helpText: The number of SnowSQL statements per database call for Multi-Statement support. Ensure you enter the exact number of statements in your SQL Script for successful execution. The default value is set to 1.

field.label: Return Results
field.helpText: Batch Size must be set to 1 in order to get return results from the SnowSQL operation.

field.label: Batch Size
field.helpText: Represents the number of requests per database call. SnowSQL operation returns results of the Query executed in SQL script if batch size is equal to 1.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Truncate before loading
field.helpText: Empty snowflake table before loading data into it.

field.label: S3 Bucket Name
field.helpText: AWS S3 bucket name.

field.label: AWS Region
field.helpText: Select the name of the AWS Region in which your account resides.

field.label: Internal Stage Name
field.helpText: Snowflake internal stage name. Leave the field empty to not use internal staging. Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Internal Source Files Path
field.helpText: File path in this format: [path_to_file]/[filename]. Path and name of the file(s) to upload. Wildcard characters (*, ?) are supported to enable uploading multiple files in a directory. Leave the field empty if not using internal staging.

field.label: Parallelism
field.helpText: Specifies the number of threads to use for uploading files. Supported values: Any integer value from 1 (no parallelism) to 99 (use 99 threads for uploading files).

field.label: PUT Compression
field.helpText: Specifies the method of compression used on already-compressed files that are being staged.

field.label: Overwrite
field.helpText: When checked Snowflake overwrites any existing file with the same name during upload.

field.label: Column Names
field.helpText: Specifies an explicit set of fields/columns (separated by commas) to load from the staged data files.

field.label: File Format Name
field.helpText: File Format Name already predefined in snowflake. Leave empty if you don't want to use a predifined file format

field.label: File Format Type
field.helpText: Specifies source file format.

field.label: COPY INTO Compression
field.helpText: Specifies the method of compression used on already-compressed files that are being staged.

field.label: Other Format Options (space separated)
field.helpText: Leave the field empty if no other format option needs to be provided, e.g. snowflake_parameterName_0 = value snowflake_parameterName_1 = value (space separated)

field.label: Copy Options
field.helpText: Leave the field empty if no copy option needs to be provided, e.g. snowflake_parameterName_0 = value snowflake_parameterName_1 = value (space separated)

field.label: Auto Compress
field.helpText: When checked Snowflake uses gzip to compress files during upload.

field.label: Chunk Size (MB)
field.helpText: Chunking is only available for CSV and JSON file formats (MB), -1 to disable chunking

field.label: Stage Path
field.helpText: This path will be used as the target location for staging the data prior to copying into Snowflake table. If left empty, an internal default path will be used.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: S3 Bucket Name
field.helpText: AWS S3 bucket name.

field.label: AWS Region
field.helpText: Select the name of the AWS Region in which your account resides

field.label: Internal Stage Name
field.helpText: Snowflake internal stage name. Leave the field empty to not use internal staging. Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: File Format Name
field.helpText: File Format Name already predefined in snowflake. Leave empty if you don't want to use a predefined file format

field.label: File Format Type
field.helpText: Specifies source file format.

field.label: COPY INTO Compression
field.helpText: Specifies the method of compression used on already-compressed files that are being staged.

field.label: Other Format Options (space separated)
field.helpText: Leave the field empty if no other format option needs to be provided, e.g. snowflake_parameterName_0 = value snowflake_parameterName_1 = value (space separated)

field.label: Copy Options
field.helpText: Leave the field empty if no copy option needs to be provided, e.g. snowflake_parameterName_0 = value snowflake_parameterName_1 = value (space separated)

field.label: Include Column Header
field.helpText: Set this option to TRUE to include the table column headings in the output files.

field.label: Stage Path
field.helpText: This path will be used as the target location for staging the data prior to copying into Snowflake table. If left empty, an internal default path will be used.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Destination
field.helpText: Unloads data from a table (or query) into one or more files in one of the following locations: Named internalStage | Named externalStage (Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage, or Microsoft Azure) | externalLocation (Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage, or Microsoft Azure).

field.label: External Location Credentials
field.helpText: Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage or Microsoft Azure

field.label: File Format Name
field.helpText: File Format Name already predefined in snowflake. Leave empty if you don't want to use a predefined file format

field.label: File Format Type
field.helpText: Specifies source file format.

field.label: Format Compression
field.helpText: Specifies the method of compression used on already-compressed files that are being staged.

field.label: Other Format Options (space separated)
field.helpText: Leave the field empty if no other format option needs to be provided, e.g. snowflake_parameterName_0 = value snowflake_parameterName_1 = value (space separated)

field.label: Copy Options
field.helpText: Leave the field empty if no copy option needs to be provided, e.g. snowflake_parameterName_0 = value snowflake_parameterName_1 = value (space separated)

field.label: Include Column Header
field.helpText: Set this option to TRUE to include the table column headings in the output files.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Column Names
field.helpText: Specifies an explicit set of fields/columns (separated by commas) to load from the staged data files.

field.label: Source
field.helpText: internalStage | externalStage | externalLocation

field.label: External Location Credentials
field.helpText: Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage or Microsoft Azure

field.label: Files
field.helpText: Specifies a list of one or more files names (separated by commas) to be loaded. The files must already have been staged in either the Snowflake internal location or external location specified in the command.

field.label: PATTERN
field.helpText: A regular expression pattern string, specifying the file names and/or paths to match

field.label: File Format Name
field.helpText: File Format Name already predefined in snowflake. Leave empty if you don't want to use a predefined file format

field.label: File Format Type
field.helpText: Specifies source file format.

field.label: Format Compression
field.helpText: Specifies the method of compression used on already-compressed files that are being staged.

field.label: Other Format Options (space separated)
field.helpText: Leave the field empty if no other format option needs to be provided, e.g. snowflake_parameterName_0 = value snowflake_parameterName_1 = value (space separated)

field.label: Copy Options
field.helpText: Leave the field empty if no copy option needs to be provided, e.g. snowflake_parameterName_0 = value snowflake_parameterName_1 = value (space separated)

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Internal Stage
field.helpText: Specifies the location in Snowflake from which to download the files

field.label: File Name
field.helpText: Specifies the URI for the data file(s) downloaded to the client machine

field.label: Parallelism
field.helpText: Specifies the number of threads to use for uploading files. Supported values: Any integer value from 1 (no parallelism) to 99 (use 99 threads for uploading files).

field.label: PATTERN
field.helpText: Specifies a regular expression pattern for filtering files to download. The command lists all files in the specified path and applies the regular expression pattern on each of the files found.

field.label: Override Connection Settings
field.helpText: Override Database and Schema

field.label: Database Name
field.helpText: Database name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: Schema Name
field.helpText: Schema name, Case-sensitive if written between double quotation marks.

field.label: File Name
field.helpText: Specifies the URI for the data file(s) downloaded to the Snowflake internal stage

field.label: Internal Stage
field.helpText: Specifies the location in Snowflake to which to upload the files

field.label: Parallelism
field.helpText: Specifies the number of threads to use for uploading files. Supported values: Any integer value from 1 (no parallelism) to 99 (use 99 threads for uploading files).

field.label: Auto Compress
field.helpText: When checked Snowflake uses gzip to compress files during upload.

field.label: Source Compression
field.helpText: Specifies the method of compression used on already-compressed files that are being staged.

field.label: Overwrite
field.helpText: When checked Snowflake overwrites any existing file with the same name during upload.
